intro: Cuphea grisebachiana, commonly known as the silverleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant belongs to the Lythraceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile choice for landscaping. Its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators make it a popular choice among horticulturists.
